column4: ok, my maverick livecd really isn't booting... I just get an eternal spinning disk after clicking on Try Ubuntu
any ideas what's going on?
tried running the CD integrity test?
nope, is that something I can do from the disk itself?
it's odd because it's been booting just fine until now
should do, when it's booting up you should see it right there
what could possibly have caused it to stop working now?
http://static.howtoforge.com/images/the_perfect_desktop_ubuntu7.04/1.jpg <=== something like that. it COULD look different on the 10.10 live CDs
ah, yeah that menu is hidden now on 10.10
okay, well if you can unhide it somehow then you should be able to find the test there
other than that, i can only advise you to try things like booting it in safe graphics mode, for example

so it's either an incompatibility with your hardware and ubuntu (in which case you need to fiddle with different boot options) or the CD is just bad, which will require either reburning one on a slower speed setting, or using better CDs... etc.
but that's just it... it's been booting just fine up until now... including 20 minutes ago... and I never removed it from the tray, so it's not like it acquired a scratch since then
installer seems to work though, just not the trial
you could try using the CD in a different computer or a different CD in the same computer
that'll help you diagnose the problem
heh, now the trial is working... man, this makes no sense :P
if it helps, i've always found liveCDs to be incredibly flakey
i usually use USB sticks instead
I would, but I can't get any USB sticks to boot on this machine for the life of me
been able to do it before, but not lately
gotta love terrible, inconsistent BIOS menus for configuring boot orders
